speaker: KING
text_entry: SCENE II. Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Enter COUNTESS and Clown

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Come on, sir; I shall now put you to the height of

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: your breeding.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I will show myself highly fed and lowly taught: I

speaker: Clown
text_entry: know my business is but to the court.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To the court! why, what place make you special,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: when you put off that with such contempt? But to the court!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Truly, madam, if God have lent a man any manners, he

speaker: Clown
text_entry: may easily put it off at court: he that cannot make

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a leg, put off's cap, kiss his hand and say nothing,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: has neither leg, hands, lip, nor cap; and indeed

speaker: Clown
text_entry: such a fellow, to say precisely, were not for the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: court; but for me, I have an answer will serve all

speaker: Clown
text_entry: men.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Marry, that's a bountiful answer that fits all

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: questions.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: It is like a barber's chair that fits all buttocks,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the pin-buttock, the quatch-buttock, the brawn

speaker: Clown
text_entry: buttock, or any buttock.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Will your answer serve fit to all questions?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: As fit as ten groats is for the hand of an attorney,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: as your French crown for your taffeta punk, as Tib's

speaker: Clown
text_entry: rush for Tom's forefinger, as a pancake for Shrove

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Tuesday, a morris for May-day, as the nail to his

speaker: Clown
text_entry: hole, the cuckold to his horn, as a scolding queen

speaker: Clown
text_entry: to a wrangling knave, as the nun's lip to the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: friar's mouth, nay, as the pudding to his skin.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Have you, I say, an answer of such fitness for all

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: questions?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: From below your duke to beneath your constable, it

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will fit any question.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: It must be an answer of most monstrous size that

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: must fit all demands.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But a trifle neither, in good faith, if the learned

speaker: Clown
text_entry: should speak truth of it: here it is, and all that

speaker: Clown
text_entry: belongs to't. Ask me if I am a courtier: it shall

speaker: Clown
text_entry: do you no harm to learn.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To be young again, if we could: I will be a fool in

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: question, hoping to be the wiser by your answer. I

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: pray you, sir, are you a courtier?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: O Lord, sir! There's a simple putting off. More,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: more, a hundred of them.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Sir, I am a poor friend of yours, that loves you.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: O Lord, sir! Thick, thick, spare not me.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I think, sir, you can eat none of this homely meat.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: O Lord, sir! Nay, put me to't, I warrant you.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: You were lately whipped, sir, as I think.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: O Lord, sir! spare not me.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Do you cry, 'O Lord, sir!' at your whipping, and

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: 'spare not me?' Indeed your 'O Lord, sir!' is very

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: sequent to your whipping: you would answer very well

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: to a whipping, if you were but bound to't.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I ne'er had worse luck in my life in my 'O Lord,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sir!' I see things may serve long, but not serve ever.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I play the noble housewife with the time

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To entertain't so merrily with a fool.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: O Lord, sir! why, there't serves well again.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: An end, sir; to your business. Give Helen this,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: And urge her to a present answer back:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Commend me to my kinsmen and my son:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: This is not much.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Not much commendation to them.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Not much employment for you: you understand me?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Most fruitfully: I am there before my legs.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Haste you again.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Exeunt severally
